result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan R. Brandau

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: FACE SHEET & TRANSMISSION VERIFICATION REPORT, SENT TO TOMAH PROBATION
DEF PRESENT W/ATTY FUDGE - CASE DISMISSED & READ IN
Letter received from Attorney Fudge to Judge Rice dated May 28, 2015.
for Pretrial Conference and Status (Not Guilty Plea Entered)

Defendant appears via VTC with Attorney Rhodes (for Attorney Fudge).  Defendant waives reading and enters Not Guilty plea.
Pretrial Offer- May 26, 2015
Pretrial Conference- June 8, 2015 @ 1:30 p.m.
Status Conference- June 22, 2015 @ 3:00 p.m.

Defendant appears via VTC with Attorney Hamm.  Court orders $1,000 Signature Bond with conditions.
Initial Appearance- May 11, 2015 @ 9:00 a.m.
Initial appearance on May 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose.
No acts or threats of violence.
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  UPON SIGNING OF THE BOND, DEFENDANT MUST APPEAR AT THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE TO SIGN UP DURING THE HOURS OF 8:00 A.M. - 4:30 P.M.  THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE IS LOCATED AT 919 HOESCHLER DRIVE, SUITE 100, SPARTA, WI.
Curfew 7pm-7am, except employment purposes or treatment purposes, as approved by the Bond Monitoring Program and must provide a schedule 48 hours in advance to the Bond Monitoring Program.
No contact with C. M. or her residence.
